snippet: Analysts who study terrorist groups said the militants’ tactics had backfired badly, particularly in Jordan.
abstract: Analysts who study terrorist groups say Islamic State's tactics of killing foreign hostages have largely backfired, especially in Jordan, where such brutality has prompted even skeptical Jordanians to rally around their government and denounce extremists.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon; Karam Shoumali from Istanbul; Michael S. Schmidt from Washington; and Martin Fackler from Tokyo.

lead_paragraph: Analysts who study terrorist groups said the militants’ tactics had backfired badly, particularly in Jordan.

headline.main: ISIS Tactics Questioned as Hostages Dwindle
headline.print_headline: ISIS Tactics Questioned as Hostages Dwindle

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
